term.title: host-vector system

item.text: A compatible combination of host (e.g. bacteria) and vector (e.g. plasmid) that allows propagation of DNA.

sources.item: PAC, 1992, 64, 143. 'Glossary for chemists of terms used in biotechnology (IUPAC Recommendations 1992)' on page 156 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199264010143)

term.citation: Citation: 'host-vector system' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.H02860

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
